instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00012: What is 820-00012? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00012</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorted on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Hi,
This I/O board from a Macbook Pro Retina 2015 is preventing the main board to start because it's shorted on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL>.
Do you have a schematic for it? I cannot find it on internet.
Can I inject some voltage on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> to find the short?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00012</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorted on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Once RIO board is disconnected from MLB, is safe to inject voltage.
Start with 1V, as always; set amp limit on PSU to max first.
